                                     English


New Super Mario Bros. for Nintendo DS


New Super Mario Bros.. (Japanese: NYU Supa Mario BurazÃƒâ€žÃ‚ï¿½zu?) Is a 2D platform video game published and developed by Nintendo for the Nintendo DS handheld. It was released in North America and Japan in May 2006, Australia and Europe in June of that year and in March 2007 in South Korea [1] He was the first original game featuring 2D platform since Super Mario Mario Land 2: 6 Golden Coins in 1992 and the first part of the main Mario series since Super Mario Sunshine in 2002.

In general, the game is based on the 2D games of the series, however, is not a direct sequel or legitimate Super Mario Bros.. 3 or Super Mario World. New Super Mario Bros.. Mario follows the holder in its challenge to rescue Princess Peach as must face Bowser's henchmen. Mario has access to several power ups which help you on your adventure, including the Super Mushroom, Fire Flower and the Starman, each giving him unique abilities. While traveling through eight different worlds with a total of 80 levels, Mario must defeat Bowser and Bowser Jr. to finally be able to rescue Princess Peach.

Reviews were generally favorable to the title. The accolades were focused on improvements made to the Mario series, while critics have focused on its simplicity. New Super Mario Bros.. received several certificates of honor, including awards for "Game of the Month" and Game Informer magazines Electronic Gaming Monthly, awards and "Editors' Choice" from IGN and GameSpot. In Japan, he broke the record for highest sales soon after its launch titles from Nintendo DS. In total, we sold approximately 18.45 million copies worldwide, making it the second best selling game for the DS and the fourth best selling handheld game of all time.

Its sequel, New Super Mario Bros.. Wii was launched on 12 November 2009, the first game of the series that can be played by four people simultaneously.
